title: U.N. Security Council Adopts Trump’s Peace Plan for Gaza
summary: Russia and China abstained. The vote provides a legal mandate for the Trump administration’s vision of how to move past the cease-fire to rebuild the war-ravaged enclave after two years of war.

title: After Hundreds of Gazans Arrive on Mystery Flights, South Africa Asks How
summary: A little-known group sold passage to desperate Palestinians who didn’t know their destination, catching the South African government by surprise.

title: Trump Bows to Reality on Epstein Files Vote, in a Rare Retreat
summary: Faced with a mass defection on a bill to demand the release of the Epstein files, the president rushed to avoid an embarrassing loss, suggesting a slip in his iron grip on the G.O.P.

title: As Trump Looks for Distraction on Epstein, Justice Dept. Rushes to His Aid
summary: The department was deployed, in effect, as an arm of the president’s rapid-response operation to help him muscle through a damaging news cycle over Jeffrey Epstein, former and current officials said.

title: Judge Says Justice Dept. May Have Committed Misconduct in Comey Case
summary: The magistrate judge raised the question of whether “government misconduct” in the case might require dismissing the charges against the former F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, altogether.

title: Fed Governor Lisa Cook Says Housing Official Worked With Trump to Tarnish Her
summary: New York’s attorney general, Letitia James, and a Federal Reserve governor, Lisa Cook, sought to publicize the role of the housing official, Bill Pulte, in executing President Trump’s retribution agenda.

title: David Richardson, Acting FEMA Administration, Resigns
summary: David Richardson had been on the job for six months. FEMA employees had questioned his ability to lead the agency.

title: The Fed Is Cutting Bank Oversight. Critics See Risks.
summary: The regulator is cutting staff and easing oversight in ways that critics say might make supervisors less equipped to spot a crisis in advance, risking deeper damage to the economy.

title: As Struggling Farmers Take On Debt, a Bailout From D.C. May Come Too Late
summary: It could be months before they receive aid, well after the winter period when they talk to their bankers and make decisions about the planting ahead.

title: High Beef Prices? Trump Official Blames Biden and Migrants.
summary: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said migrants were bringing sick cows across the border, snarling beef supply chains.

title: Andy Baraghani’s Thanksgiving Menu Is Bright, Colorful and Delicious
summary: Andy Baraghani’s bright, brilliant menu is a feast for the eyes, too.

title: A Councilwoman Intervened During an ICE Arrest. Then She Faced the Voters.
summary: Months before the election, Etel Haxhiaj, a councilwoman in Worcester, Mass., was charged with assaulting an officer when she stood between the police and an immigrant family.

title: E.P.A. Drastically Limits Protections for Wetlands
summary: The proposal could strip federal protections from most U.S. wetlands, some of which feed drinking water systems.

title: A Plan for Private Jet Taxes Would Fund Climate Measures
summary: A small group of countries is aiming to impose a fee on private jets and premium commercial fares. The revenue would help nations adapt to warming.

title: After Marshawn Kneeland’s Death, Cowboys Prepare to Take the Field Again
summary: Marshawn Kneeland spent nearly all of his 24 years working to get to the N.F.L. He died two days after scoring his first touchdown.

title: A.I. Chatbots Are Changing How Patients Get Medical Advice
summary: Frustrated by the medical system, some patients are turning to chatbots for help. At what cost?

title: Europe Begins Rethinking Its Crackdown on Big Tech
summary: European policymakers are crafting changes to scale back and simplify landmark rules for A.I. and data privacy, in a shift from an aggressive regulatory period.

title: Jeff Bezos Creates A.I. Start-Up Where He Will Be Co-Chief Executive
summary: Called Project Prometheus, the company is focusing on artificial intelligence for the engineering and manufacturing of computers, automobiles and spacecraft.

title: Why Britain Is Embracing ‘Negative Nation Branding’
summary: Prime Minister Keir Starmer, trying to get a grip on a feverish immigration debate, is introducing a hard-line, contentious policy on refugees.

title: We Can Now Track Individual Monarch Butterflies. It’s a Revelation.
summary: Scientists used tiny new sensors to follow the insects on journeys that take thousands of miles to their winter colonies in Mexico.

title: Ballet Dancers Are Starting to Prioritize Their Mental Health
summary: Dancers are famous for buckling down and getting through it. But a new openness about mental health has companies and schools focusing on their well-being, both physical and emotional.

title: The Case for Overthrowing Maduro
summary: Thinking through the case for intervention in Venezuela.

title: Here’s What Trump Should Actually Do for Fertility
summary: Trump’s policies on in vitro fertilization are underwhelming but his announcement still made me optimistic.

title: The U.N. Security Council Backs Trump’s Gaza Plan
summary: Also, it’s a big week for the art market. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

title: Indiana Homeowner Charged in Shooting of Cleaning Woman Who Arrived at Wrong House
summary: A man was charged with manslaughter after a woman was shot through the front door of a home before dawn this month in suburban Indianapolis.

title: MacKenzie Scott Gives $700 Million to Historically Black Colleges
summary: The donations to over a dozen schools come as the Trump administration is directing more funds to the historically Black institutions, too.

title: The Mayor of Secaucus Has a Fix for America: ‘Say Yes to Everyone’
summary: As South Asian and Muslim immigrants transform a small New Jersey town, the five-term mayor has managed to keep the peace. What happens when he’s gone?

title: France Steps Up Fight Against Disinformation as U.S. Pulls Back, Official Says
summary: The French government is trying to make the case that governments can call out foreign malign influence campaigns and protect speech.
